title: "fatal runtime error: stack overflow" when incorrectly implementing the display Trait
body:
Hi everyone! I've been hacking around with Rust for while now, and towards the end of the Book I saw the "OutlinePrint" example regarding Supertraits and tried to implement it myslef. However I made a mistake the first time as i wrote `self` instead of `self.0` on a tuple struct while implementing the `fmt` method, which resulted in a stack overflow. This is obviously on me, but it also seems to me the code shouldn't have compiled, since **type inference looks possible** to the rustling I am :) I'm not entirely sure I should file a bug on that and again, am new to Rust, so it's more than possible that I'm wrong, but better safe than sorry! Anyway, here's the code that compiled and let to a stack overflow: ```rust use std::fmt; fn main() { trait OutlinePrint: fmt::Display { fn outline_print(&self) { let output = self.to_string(); let len = output.len(); println!("{}", "*".repeat(len + 4)); println!("*{}*", " ".repeat(len + 2)); println!("* {} *", output); println!("*{}*", " ".repeat(len + 2)); println!("{}", "*".repeat(len + 4)); } } struct Name(String); impl Name { fn new(s: String) -> Self { Name(s) } } impl fmt::Display for Name { fn fmt(&self, f: &mut fmt::Formatter<'_>) -> fmt::Result { write!(f, "{}", self) } } impl OutlinePrint for Name {} let moi = Name::new("Theo".to_string()); moi.outline_print(); } ``` I expected to get a compiler error, got a stack overflow. ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.52.0 (88f19c6da 2021-05-03) binary: rustc commit-hash: 88f19c6dab716c6281af7602e30f413e809c5974 commit-date: 2021-05-03 host: aarch64-apple-darwin release: 1.52.0 LLVM version: 12.0.0 ```
Backtrace

``` thread 'main' has overflowed its stack fatal runtime error: stack overflow zsh: abort cargo run ```

P.S.: Rust is awesome!
